org.opentrafficsim.core.network

Class Network<ID,L extends AbstractLink<?,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractSet<E>
        • java.util.HashSet<L>
          • org.opentrafficsim.core.network.Network<ID,L>
  • Type Parameters:
    ID - the ID type of the network.
    L -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<L>, Collection<L>, Set<L>

    public class Network<ID,L extends AbstractLink<?,?>>
extends HashSet<L>
implements Serializable
    A Network consists of a set of links. Each link has, in its turn, a start node and an end node. In addition, a network can be an (expanded) node as well. An example is shown below: 
                |
     -------O--------
            |
    can be expanded into: 
                |
            A
           /|\
          / | \
    -----B--C--D-----
          \ | /
           \|/
            E
            |
    Node O in the example is expanded into the subnetwork consisting of nodes A, B, C, D, and E, and links AB, AC, AD, BC, CD, BE, CE, and DE. It also means that when node expansion takes place, the links to node O have to be replaced. In the example below: 
                X
            |
     Y------O-------Z
            |
            W
    can be expanded into: 
                X
            |
            A
           /|\
          / | \
    Y----B--C--D----Z
          \ | /
           \|/
            E
            |
            W
    the node XO is replaced by XA, YO is replaced by YB, OZ is replaced by DZ, and OW is replaced by EW in the network. The reverse takes place when we do node collapse.

    Copyright (c) 2013-2014 Delft University of Technology, PO Box 5, 2600 AA, Delft, the Netherlands. All rights reserved.
    BSD-style license. See OpenTrafficSim License.

    Version:
    Aug 19, 2014
    Author:
    Alexander Verbraeck, Peter Knoppers, Guus Tamminga
    See Also:

      Network(ID id, Collection<? extends L> collection, AbstractNode<?,?> expansionNode)
      Construction of a network with an initial set of links, and an expansion node.

      • Network

        public Network(ID id,
       Collection<? extends L> collection,
       AbstractNode<?,?> expansionNode)
        throws NetworkException
        Construction of a network with an initial set of links, and an expansion node.
        Parameters:
        id - the network id.
        collection - the initial collection of links.
        expansionNode - Node of which this network is an expansion.
        Throws:
        NetworkException - when expansion node is part of the initial collection.
